intro: Rorippa clavata, commonly known as watercress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its alternate, pinnately divided leaves that are often submerged or floating in aquatic environments. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers with four petals, typical of the mustard family. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to absorb nutrients from water, while its stems are often prostrate or erect depending on the habitat. Rorippa clavata is commonly found in moist or aquatic habitats, including ponds, streams, and wetlands.
